articles.content:
Press conference at Yugoslav embassy
     Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- A press conference was held at the Yugoslav embassy in Korea on Wednesday.    Present were newspaper and news agency reporters in Pyongyang, foreign journalists and press attaches of foreign embassies here.   
   In his speech Yugoslav ambassador Ljubomir Djukic said that the U.S.-led NATO has destroyed many military and civilian objects since it launched air raids on Yugoslavia. 
He stated they far surpass the crimes of Nazi Germany in barbarity and cruelty.
    He went on:    The indiscriminate air raids by NATO left hundreds of thousands of workers jobless. That is why peace-loving countries and people call for stopping air raids at an early date.   
    A brutal air raid on the Chinese embassy in Yugoslavia by NATO is unprecedented in history.
    Although the U.S.-led NATO continues to intensify air raids, it will not break the will of the Yugoslav people to defend the territorial integrity and sovereignty of the country. 
   Answers were given to questions at the press conference.

articles.content:
Scheme to intensify cooperation system against N. Korea
    Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. military magazine Defense News on May 10 quoted officials of the Defence Agency of Japan as saying that the agency and the Ministry of National Defense of South Korea on May 6 set up a hot line for exchange of military information about North Korea, according to a report.   
   A communication circuit is reportedly to open in addition between military officials of both sides toward the end of this month.
   This clearly shows that the Japanese reactionaries and the South Korean ruling quarters are getting more frantic  in the moves to intensify the cooperation system to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.

articles.title: Dry weather in DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. special exhibition
   Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The United States held a special exhibition on the 50th anniversary of the Korean War at the Macarthur Memorial in Virginia on May 10, according to a report.
   The exhibition will last till May next year. It is aimed at making false propaganda about the fiction of southward invasion by North Korea. 
   The United States is to hold four more similar exhibitions  till October 2003 following the special exhibition.
   Such smear campaign of the United States designed to cover up the criminal nature of its war of aggression and hoodwink people is a mockery of and challenge to world's justice and conscience.

articles.title: Powerful socialism, led by great commander
articles.content:
Dry weather in DPRK
   Pyongyang, May 13 (KCNA) -- The dry weather persists in the DPRK.
   This year, the DPRK has been frequently affected by warm and dry winds from the west. As a result, its precipitation is very small and most of regions have been hit by droughts.   Rainfall from January to May 10 in Pyongyang and South Phyongan Province is 76 to 117 mm each, or 33 to 56 mm less than the average, that in north Phyongan and Jagang provinces is 81 to 153 mm each, or 7 to 31 mm less than the average and that in north and south Hwanghae provinces is 58 to 144 mm each, or 51 to 110 mm less than the average.   
And the rainfall in Kangwon Province is 68 to 240 mm, or 40 to 146 mm less than the average, that in north and south Hamgyong provinces 23 to 94 mm each, or 21 to 91 mm less than the average and that in Ryanggang Province is 42 to 72mm, or 4 to 21 mm less than the average.   Particularly, Chongjin has had no rain for 92 consecutive days and Wonsan and Hamhung for 119 consecutive days.
  Droughts are still persisting in the DPRK.
